review: I find the stick very sluggish in its responsiveness relative to the older Roku 2 I have on my other TV. Additionally, the AC adapter to power the unit other than through the TV (necessary unless you want to wait for the unit to reboot and load for 40 seconds every time you turn off your TV) died within 3 days. Finally, location of the microUSB plug on the streaming stick (on the opposite end of the HDMI port) is poor and ultimately results in the unit being longer than advertised and so, this unit (or the USB wire) stick out from the side of my TV on an otherwise perfectly crisp and visible wire-free set up. Despite this, the Roku software itself is still top notch and if anything, I would return this to trade up for a full Roku 3.
author: S. Sheinfeld

review: Horrible, simply horrible - do not let the allure of apps entice you to buy this waste of money.1) - Set-up was a pain.  Took 15 minutes to resolve the unable to connect issues.  I had to manually add the MAC address, and even after that, it drops connectively.  No other device in my house does this2)  Horrible website to set up - please, you need a credit card to order FREE apps.  Once you add your apps, you are push to use the device to add more.3)  Remote - Did I read fisher price on this, or is this just a fake remote?  This remote has not value.  Buttons stick which forces you to miss your selection, range is aweful, and the build quality is non-existent.4) 480P digitized looking background on a 1080P screen???  The UI of this device needs improvement.  When you purposely want high def TV, you expect a high def UI.  I changed the settings to 1080P, played with the themes, nothing.I bought this device because I love my chromecast device, but wanted to make it easier for the family to watch shows without casting.  This device missed the mark and more5)  Missed one - Rendering time... welcome to watching paint dry.  Chromecast vs Roku Stick... wow, chromecast blows this device away.I sooo wanted this device to live up to the hype, but back to the store you go... next on the test list, Amazon Fire devices.
